newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan stocks end up 1.38 pct at six-year high.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan stocks end up 1.38 pct at six-year high.

text.p: Taiwan share prices closed at a six-year high on Saturday on strong rises in the index's most heavily weighted financials, brokers said.
The index ended up 108.39 points, or 1.38 percent, at 7,983.71, off an intraday high of 8,000.32.
Saturday's finish marked the highest close since the market ended at 8,059.14 points on May 16, 1990.
Turnover was a hectic T$107.77 billion.
Financials surged 3.80 percent, with Cathay Life up T$8 to T$187 and Chang Hwa Bank up by the daily seven percent limit to T$190.

"Just like in the past, almost everytime when the index needs to break through some psychologically important level, investors would try to push up the most heavily weighted fiancials," said George Hou, a fund manager at Jardine Fleming.
"Now the index has risen more than 1,000 points so far this year and is facing the 8,000-point resistance, investors naturally turned to buy financials," Hou said.
China-concept shares, those with investments in China, also attracted heavy buying on local newspaper reports that several foreign funds are raising equity funds for investment in China, Hou said.
Bicycle maker Giant, which has plants in China, was limit up to T$54.
Brokers said they expected volatile trade ahead after recent gains. For next week, a 7,800-8,200 range was seen.
